content.description: Fun easy crack in the middleish of the crag. Beware of a loose block towards the top.
content.protection: pro to 3 in. Gear anchor on top.

content.description: Start from crack or direct to a bolt, slabby moves up to another bolt.  Pass the roof to the right (small cams here) and continue up easier climbing to a 2 bolt anchor/rap.
content.location: To the left of Elmer Fudd and is the second climb from the left.

content.description: Pass by three bolts the third is up and right a tad, and tun a small headwall. Gear anchor. I am sure there is a walkoff but we had a rope already on Mighty Mouse.
content.protection: Three bolts a small rack to 2 in. for the roof and the anchor.
content.location:
To the right of

Yosemite Sam

about 15 feet.

climbs.name: Silver Surfer
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, May 2007

content.description: Begin just left of Super Chiken. Stem up a trough, then move right and lieback a right-slanting thin crack/corner.
content.protection: Thin to 3 inches. 2 #3 camalots are useful for the anchor. 4th class scramble off to the right.

content.description: No distinct crux.  At times it's hard to avoid jamming on the left side crack.
content.protection: A few thin,flaring nut placements and thin cams sews it up. Gear seemed bomber, though.
content.location: Obvious thin S-crack (from which it draws its namesake) in the gully just to the right of Yosemite Sam.

content.description: S shaped crack just left of Yosemite Sam.  Start up the dark varnish on good crimps to gain the crack.  Climb up and join Yosemite Sam
content.protection: Fingers gear for the route plus some hand pieces for the Yosemite Sam finish
content.location: Just left of Yosemite Sam, right of Elmer Fudd and Capt. Kangaroo

climbs.name: Mighty Mouse
climbs.fa: Tony Sartin and Bob Gaines, May 2007

content.description: Begin at the far left of the formation, just left of Underdog. Climb the slab and traverse left at a horizontal, then over a bulge (5.10-).The upper roof, although intimidating, is easier than it looks (5.10-), with a big reach followed by an awkward mantle.
content.protection:
3 bolts plus thin to 2 inch CDs.

2 bolt belay/rappel anchor at the top.

content.description:
Begin on the far right side of the cliff and climb an easy flake on a low angle slab, then up a wider almost off width crack right of Baba Louie and Chilkoot Sam. Basically Baba Louie's fourth class start with an interesting crack exit move.

4th class downclimb off right side.
content.protection: bigger gear for the crack, medium for the anchor

climbs.name: Elmer Fudd
climbs.fa: (TR) Tod Swain, 11/88 First Lead: Bob Gaines, Tom Murphy, & Tony Sartin, 5/07

content.description: Flake system to face on left side of central buttress. Excellent rock quality!
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2-bolt anchor. Pro to 3 inches for the start.

content.description:
Begin on the far right side of the cliff and climb an easy flake on a low angle slab, then up a thin crack to the right of

Baba Louie

. Basically Baba Louie's fourth class start with a fun thin crack exit move.

4th class downclimb off right side.
content.protection: thin for climbing, Med. for anchor

content.description: Start up Elmer Fudd then about 15' up move right and follow a seam/crack straight up the butress.

climbs.name: Baba Louie
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, May 2007

content.description:
Begin on the far right side of the cliff and climb an easy flake on a low angle slab, then up through a slot and over a bulge.

4th class downclimb off right side.
content.protection: Pro to 3 inches. (Two #3 camalots are useful for the anchor)
